tool.name: MSI ion images
tool.command: #if $infile.ext == 'imzml' cp '${infile.extra_files_path}/imzml' infile.imzML && cp '${infile.extra_files_path}/ibd' infile.ibd && #elif $infile.ext == 'analyze75' cp '${infile.extra_files_path}/hdr' infile.hdr && cp '${infile.extra_files_path}/img' infile.img && cp '${infile.extra_files_path}/t2m' infile.t2m && #else ln -s $infile infile.RData && #end if cat '${MSI_heatmaps}' && Rscript '${MSI_heatmaps}'

param.name: infile
param.label: Inputfile as imzML, Analyze7.5 or Cardinal MSImageSet saved as RData
param.help: Upload composite datatype imzml (ibd+imzML) or analyze75 (hdr+img+t2m) or regular upload .RData (Cardinal MSImageSet)

param.name: filename
param.label: Title
param.help: will appear in the quality report. If nothing given it will take the dataset name

param.name: massfile
param.label: Text file with masses and names
param.help: first column mass (m/z), second column mass name, tab separated file

param.name: image_contrast
param.label: Select a contrast enhancement function for the heatmap images
param.help: The 'histogram' equalization method flatterns the distribution of intensities. The hotspot 'suppression' method uses thresholding to reduce the intensities of hotspots

param.name: image_smoothing
param.label: Select an image smoothing function for the heatmap images
param.help: The 'gaussian' smoothing method smooths images with a simple gaussian kernel. The 'adaptive' method uses bilateral filtering to preserve edges

tool.help:
Heatmaps for different masses in mass-spectrometry imaging data as pdf output.
Input data:
3 types of mass-spectrometry imaging data can be used:
- imzml file (upload imzml and ibd file via the "composite" function) `Introduction to the imzml format <http://ms-imaging.org/wp/introduction/>`_ - Analyze7.5 (upload hdr, img and t2m file via the "composite" function) - Cardinal "MSImageSet" data (with variable name "msidata", saved as .RData)
tabular file with masses: - tab separated file (.tabular), datatype in Galaxy must be tabular (if Galaxy auto-detection was wrong, datatype can be changed by pressing the pen button) - first column must contain masses (separate point numbers by point, not comma) - optionally a second column with names for the masses can be provided - no empty fields or letters are allowed (tool crashes with empty fields and a single letter prohibits generation of images)
Trouble shooting: - no heatmaps are plotted when tabular file contains letters or point numbers with commas or when the input MSI file had no intensities > 0 - contrast enhance functions need masses with intensities > 0 in about 1.5% of all pixels - tool crashes when contrast enhance is used on too few intensities
